(1)
East River, New York's shoreline, from East 97th (left) to East 99th Streets, showing the Hagedorn Brothers coal yard and P.S. No. 99 on the north side of East 99th Street, between the river and First Ave.
September 20, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, looking north up the Harlem River. (The Harlem River begins at East 100th Street), and showing the Burns Brothers coal yard between East 100th and East 101st Streets (Harlem River), and (right) Wards Island.
September 20, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as view 1, at a later date, showing a more extensive view.
March 7, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 97th and 99th Streets - Queensborough Bridge - [Hagedorn Brothers Coal Company ; Burns Bros. Coal Co.]
